The "Groza" ("Thunder") modular assault rifle was intended for various special forces in the Russian Army and Internal Affairs Ministry as an dedicated urban warfare weapon. Briefly manufactured in small numbers at the Tula Arms factory during the mid-1990s, the OTs-14 saw action in Chechnya in 1999 but fell out of favour and are no longer being made. It is a bullpup design with a removable foregrip which can be replaced with a 40mm grenade launcher. Adopted for Spetsnaz forces and specialist front-line combat units, this Zone version is equipped with the GP-25 grenade launcher.
